content.question: The binomial theorem can be used to expand an expression of the form <math alttext="open parentheses a plus b close parentheses to the power of n"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi>n</mi></msup></math>. Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="open parentheses x plus 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x to the power of 5 plus open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="x to the power of 5 plus x to the power of 4 open parentheses 3 y close parentheses plus x cubed open parentheses 3 y close parentheses squared plus x squared open parentheses 3 y close parentheses cubed plus x open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 4 plus open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="x to the power of 5 plus 4 x to the power of 4 open parentheses 3 y close parentheses plus 6 x cubed open parentheses 3 y close parentheses squared plus 6 x squared open parentheses 3 y close parentheses cubed plus 4 x open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 4 plus open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="x to the power of 5 plus 5 x to the power of 4 open parentheses 3 y close parentheses plus 10 x cubed open parentheses 3 y close parentheses squared plus 10 x squared open parentheses 3 y close parentheses cubed plus 5 x open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 4 plus open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x to the power of 5 plus 5 x to the power of 4 open parentheses 3 y close parentheses plus 10 x cubed open parentheses 3 y close parentheses squared plus 10 x squared open parentheses 3 y close parentheses cubed plus 5 x open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 4 plus open parentheses 3 y close parentheses to the power of 5"><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>5</mn></msup></math>

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
